channel.title: Next-gen and mini Axoloti hardware discussion
channel.description:
Forming a new thread for discussion of next-gen hardware that started here https://sebiik.github.io/community.axoloti.com.backup/t/where-to-buy-a-axoloti-core-out-of-stock/648/155
Updates on my progress will go here.

item.title: Next-gen and mini Axoloti hardware discussion
item.dc:creator: @servandisco servando barreiro
item.description:
@servandisco wrote:

Mutable clouds I think It was pretty intensive, also Lmnts reverb.
Add some polyphony with braids oscillators and you got already something that would be quite intensive

Read full topic

@urklang Hello! Any chance can you ship from Europe? Customs fees are a pain for orders outside the EU...

Thanks

item.title: Next-gen and mini Axoloti hardware discussion
item.dc:creator: @JoshuaACNewman Joshua A.C. Newman
item.description:
@JoshuaACNewman wrote:

Modified patcher.

I was going to try to design something processor-intensive, but maybe you have a patch I should try out instead? I'm trying to remember what the patch was that I wrote and ran the processor up into the high 90s immediately.

Read full topic
item.source: Next-gen and mini Axoloti hardware discussion

item.title: Next-gen and mini Axoloti hardware discussion
item.dc:creator: @jaffasplaffa Mr. Grimm
item.description:
@jaffasplaffa wrote:

Thanks that sounds great

Is it just running the original patcher or is it a modified version?

What about tables and delays and so on? Audio playback from SD card? All that stuff working?

Read full topic
item.source: Next-gen and mini Axoloti hardware discussion

item.title: Next-gen and mini Axoloti hardware discussion
item.dc:creator: @JoshuaACNewman Joshua A.C. Newman
item.description:
@JoshuaACNewman wrote:

I've started doing a tutorial series on YouTube about it. I haven't done anything really processor intensive yet, but what I have done seems to use only a tiny fraction of the available processor. I'll try with my grain mangler and see what it does!

Read full topic
item.source: Next-gen and mini Axoloti hardware discussion

item.title: Next-gen and mini Axoloti hardware discussion
item.dc:creator: @jaffasplaffa Mr. Grimm
item.description:

Cool, that's nice to know, thanks

Guess I'll keep an eye on what goes on

Read full topic
item.source: Next-gen and mini Axoloti hardware discussion

item.title: Next-gen and mini Axoloti hardware discussion
item.dc:creator: @tele_player
item.description:
@tele_player wrote:

I havenâ€™t used it much. The software is a work in progress: not as complete and functional as Axoloti 1.0, not as broken as 2.0.
I have not done comprehensive testing, but the CPU is much faster, which is obvious from CPU load when the same patch is loaded on both boards.

Read full topic
item.source: Next-gen and mini Axoloti hardware discussion

item.title: Next-gen and mini Axoloti hardware discussion
item.dc:creator: @jaffasplaffa Mr. Grimm
item.description:
@jaffasplaffa wrote:

@tele_player

Ah okay

So what's the actual status?

Is it running as well as the original one?

How much can you push the RAM and CPU?

Really curious about the performance. The old Axo just had a tiny bit too little dsp for me to make full songs on a single axo, witg good quality objects.

Did you do some tests? Like running a patch that was just on the limit of the old Axo and then throw in a bunch more stuff?

Read full topic
item.source: Next-gen and mini Axoloti hardware discussion

item.title: Next-gen and mini Axoloti hardware discussion
item.dc:creator: @tele_player
item.description:
@tele_player wrote:

I don't think many have been shipped. I received one in September.

item.source: Next-gen and mini Axoloti hardware discussion

item.title: Next-gen and mini Axoloti hardware discussion
item.dc:creator: @JSZ
item.description:
@JSZ wrote:

I placed an order for the Akso but only afterwards realised it is not shipping and there is no estimate to when it will be. I totally understand one guy with a day job can't make progress on everything as fast as they would like but would really appreciate some kind of guess about the date. Based on this thread it was ready to be shipped July 14th?

Read full topic
item.source: Next-gen and mini Axoloti hardware discussion

item.title: Next-gen and mini Axoloti hardware discussion
item.dc:creator: @nicotep Nicolas Tep
item.description:
@nicotep wrote:

Yep, the Axoloti is quite powerful already ! One can run some heavy & complex patches on the little board, impressive.
Still, Akso's 32MB of SDRAM make it really interesting, especially for processing much larger samples / tables : that's 4 times the original Axoloti's SDRAM...!

Read full topic
item.source: Next-gen and mini Axoloti hardware discussion

item.title: Next-gen and mini Axoloti hardware discussion
item.dc:creator: @dreamer
item.description:
@dreamer wrote:

Good stuff! Understandable that some objects need to be ported and this needs to be reflected in the patcher (and things like cv-in/out requires some customization).

Hopefully this doesn't cause too much fragmentation of the 'ecosystem' and/or work on your end.

At this moment I have not reached the limit of what the Axoloti can do, and I need to spend more time with the axos that I have in the studio, but I'm definitely interested in this kit in the future. So I hope that you will have these available for some time to come

Read full topic

item.source: Next-gen and mini Axoloti hardware discussion

item.title: Next-gen and mini Axoloti hardware discussion
item.dc:creator: @urklang Nicolas Steven Miller
item.description:
@urklang wrote:

Hi @korb. I think I just responded to your email. The current lead time is about two weeks as I mention on the website. I did that just to get a rough sense of how many to produce and what my production schedule should be. After that I will normally have boards in stock for shipping next business day. Producing more takes about 7-10 days in general.

I apologize if this was confusing on the website. If you would prefer, I can always issue a refund now and you can place an order again when boards are in stock. Just contact me directly.

Read full topic

item.title: Next-gen and mini Axoloti hardware discussion
item.dc:creator: @urklang Nicolas Steven Miller
item.description:
@urklang wrote:

Hi @Glendene. Sorry for the confusion! That checkbox simply logs the assembly option as part of the order data in my records. It doesn't print it on the receipt at the moment.

If you send me a private message with your email address or just email me directly I'll confirm that the option was logged correctly in my records.

Read full topic
item.source: Next-gen and mini Axoloti hardware discussion

item.title: Next-gen and mini Axoloti hardware discussion
item.dc:creator: @Glendene David
item.description:
@Glendene wrote:

Have ordered the Akso, and wanted the TRS not soldered on to PCB. There was no indication that it will or will not be on the PCB. I checked the Check Box "Leave TRS jacks unassembled." The receipt does not indicate that the order will or will not have the TRS soldered.

Read full topic
item.source: Next-gen and mini Axoloti hardware discussion
